com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.sqlite
Interface SqliteOperations

All Superinterfaces:
DatastoreOperations
All Known Implementing Classes:
SqliteTemplate
public interface SqliteOperations
extends DatastoreOperations

This interface specifies methods for basic SQLite operations. This is typically not used directly, rather the implementation SqliteTemplate is used.

Version:
1.0 02/11/12
Author:
Tyler Treat

Method Detail

open

void open()
          throws SQLException
Opens the database for transactions.

Throws:
SQLException - if the database cannot be opened

close

void close()
Closes the database.

isOpen

boolean isOpen()
Indicates if the database is open.

Returns:
true if the database is open, false if not

beginTransaction

void beginTransaction()
Starts a new database transaction. If autocommit is enabled, invoking this method will have no effect. A transaction must be committed or rolled back by calling commit() or rollback(), respectively.

commit

void commit()
Commits the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.

rollback

void rollback()
Rolls back the current transaction. This method is idempotent. If no transaction is open or autocommit is enabled, this will have no effect.

isTransactionOpen

boolean isTransactionOpen()
Indicates if a transaction is currently open.

Returns:
true if a transaction is open, false if not

setAutocommit

void setAutocommit(boolean autocommit)
Sets the autocommit value for this SqliteOperations. If autocommit is enabled, a transaction must be initiated by invoking beginTransaction(). A transaction must then be committed or rolled back by calling commit() or rollback(), respectively. If autocommit is disabled, database operations will be committed when they are executed.

Parameters:
autocommit - true to enable autocommit, false to disable it

isAutocommit

boolean isAutocommit()
Indicates if autocommit is enabled or disabled.

Returns:
true if autocommit is enabled, false if not

executeForResult

Cursor executeForResult(java.lang.String sql,
                        boolean force)
                        throws SQLGrammarException
Executes the given SQL query on the database for a result.

Parameters:
sql - the SQL query to execute
force - indicates if the query should be executed regardless of transaction state
Returns:
Cursor containing the results of the query
Throws:
SQLGrammarException - if the SQL was formatted incorrectly

registerTypeAdapter

<T> void registerTypeAdapter(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                             SqliteTypeAdapter<T> adapter)
Registers the given TypeAdapter for the specified Class with this SqliteMapper instance. The TypeAdapter allows a Field of this type to be mapped to a database column. Registering a TypeAdapter for a Class which already has a TypeAdapter registered for it will result in the previous TypeAdapter being overridden.

Parameters:
type - the Class this TypeAdapter is for
adapter - the TypeAdapter to register

getRegisteredTypeAdapters

java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,SqliteTypeAdapter<?>> getRegisteredTypeAdapters()
Returns a Map containing all SqliteTypeAdapter instances registered with this Session and the Class instance in which they are registered for.

Returns:
{@code Map, SqliteTypeAdapter>
